title: What would happen if everyone stopped eating meat tomorrow? - Carolyn Beans

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated drop in food-related greenhouse gas emissions if all meat were to suddenly disappear from our shelves?

What is a potential consequence of a sudden shift away from meat consumption in regions like Mongolia?

options.label: C
options.text: A lack of food options due to the harsh environment

multiple-choice.question: What is a benefit of crop agriculture expanding in place of livestock production?

options.label: C
options.text: Workers and neighboring communities are less susceptible to respiratory diseases

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the land used to grow feed for animals raised for meat if people stop eating meat?

options.label: A
options.text: It is converted into urban areas

options.label: B
options.text: It is used to grow more feed for other animals

options.label: C
options.text: It becomes available for other uses, such as growing crops for human consumption

options.label: D
options.text: It is abandoned and left unused

options.label: A
options.text: Increased rates of heart disease and cancer

options.label: C
options.text: Millions of deaths are avoided every year due to lower rates of certain diseases

multiple-choice.question: What is a benefit of reduced meat consumption for global biodiversity?

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased pesticide use and increased natural areas

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is responsible for over 60% of all food-based emissions?
What is a potential consequence of reducing beef, cheese, and milk consumption?

options.label: C
options.text: Achieving many of the benefits of a meatless world

options.label: D
options.text: Increased rates of heart disease and cancer

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what would happen to global temperatures by the end of the century if business-as-usual food systems continue, even if we stop burning fossil fuels?

options.label: C

options.text: The case was dismissed due to lack of evidence

options.label: A
options.text: Rosa Parks' refusal to move to the back of a segregated bus

multiple-choice.question: How long did the Montgomery Bus Boycott last?

options.label: B
options.text: The court ruled in favor of desegregating public transport

options.label: B
options.text: To escape the vicious death threats she was receiving

options.label: C
options.text: To support Congressman John Conyers' civil rights campaigns

options.label: A
options.text: An institute for the education of young people

multiple-choice.question: What was Rosa Parks' philosophy regarding fear and action?

options.label: A
options.text: "Fear is what drives us to take action"

options.label: B

options.label: D
options.text: "Fear is what holds us back from taking action"

title: Rosalind Franklin: DNA's unsung hero - Cláudio L. Guerra

multiple-choice.question: When was the discovery of the structure of DNA made, which is considered one of the most important scientific achievements in human history?

title: Who were Las Mariposas, and why were they murdered? - Lisa Krause
